questions.question: Which is NOT an acronym in SMART?
When setting a timely SMART goal you should...?

choices.answer: Have a start date and end date
Set a realistic time frame to accomplish your goal
Plan your day in advance to have set time dedicated to working on your goal

questions.question: If you apply overload too quickly, it can result in a higher rate of injury
If you are struggling to stay motivated when working towards your goal you may need to...?

choices.answer: Check that your SMART goal is realistic to your life
Adjust your goal to make it vague
Adjust your goal to make it extremely challenging

questions.question: Continually and gradually increasing the intensity and/or duration of your workout in order to see improvement is...?
SMART Goals help you organize and plan out your goals so that you can accomplish them while challenging yourself
In order to help you reach the SMART goal you set for yourself you can...

choices.answer: Set the goal without an end date
Break your goal down into mini goals leading up to your main goal
Set a goal that works on all 5 health-related fitness components
Perform 20 push ups, in a row, by January 30th

questions.question: Overload and progression are properly applied to your SMART goal by...?

choices.answer: Adding 5-10 lb. weights once the body has become adapted to it
Forcing your body to stretch past your range of motion when stretching
Adding 50 lb. weights to your exercise
Running 1 mile, twice a week, for 2 months to prepare to run a marathon

questions.question: Creating a fitness plan with a friend is a great way to hold yourself accountable and motivated
